snippet: A new scientific paper suggests that American troops staged in Saudi Arabia were exposed to nerve agents released by the bombing of Iraqi chemical weapons depots during the Persian Gulf War.
abstract: Research published in journal Neuroepidemiology by authors by James J Tuite and Dr Robert Haley finds that toxic plume created by bombing Iraqi chemical weapons depots just before 1991 Persian Gulf ground campaign may have exposed amassing troops to hazardous substances; findings rebut longstanding Pentagon position supported by many scientists.
lead_paragraph: A new scientific paper suggests that American troops staged in Saudi Arabia were exposed to nerve agents released by the bombing of Iraqi chemical weapons depots during the Persian Gulf War.

headline.seo: Paper Links Nerve Agents in ’91 Gulf War and Ailments
